intro: Coffea arenesiana, commonly known as the African coffee or the Ethiopian coffee, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and white flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that contain two seeds used for coffee production. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil. Coffea arenesiana is less commonly cultivated than other coffee species but is valued for its unique flavor profile.
